meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>crime</kanji> and the verb vocab version can mean <vocabulary>to commit a crime</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to make a mistake</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>to rape</vocabulary>, depending on the context.
readingMnemonic: You go <vocabulary>to commit a crime</vocabulary>. How did it go, you think? Well, I thought it went <reading>oka</reading>y (おか). Imagine yourself committing a crime and it going just okay. Not great, not bad... meh. Okay.
